required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Trial Comparing the Efficacy and Safety of Exubera® and Lantus®
clinical_study.official_title: A Six Month, Open-Label Outpatient, Randomized Parallel Group Trial Assessing The Impact Of Dry Powder Inhaled Insulin (Exubera®) On Glycemic Control Compared To Insulin Glargine (Lantus®) In Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Who Are Poorly Controlled On A Combination Of Two Or More Oral Agents

brief_summary.textblock: To compare efficacy and safety of Exubera® vs Lantus® in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin (HbA1c) at Week 26
primary_outcome.description: Change (measured as percent): HbA1c at observation minus HbA1c at baseline. Primary objective to demonstrate non-inferiority of inhaled insulin compared to insulin glargine for glycemic control after 26 weeks of treatment not attainable due to early termination of study; analyses were descriptive and graphical.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HbA1c Prior to Week 26
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 2, Week 4, Week 8, Week 12, and Week 18
secondary_outcome.description: Change (measured as percent) from baseline calculated as HbA1c at observation minus HbA1c at baseline.
Number of subjects with glycemic control HbA1c measurement of < 6.5 % at observation.
Number of subjects with glycemic control HbA1c measurement of < 7.0 % at observation.
Number of subjects with glycemic control HbA1c measurement of < 8.0 % at observation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) Level
secondary_outcome.description: FPG measured as milligrams/deciliter (mg/dl). Change from baseline calculated as FPG at observation minus FPG at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of Home Blood Glucose Monitoring (HBGM) (7 & 8 Point)
secondary_outcome.description: Blood glucose (BG) self-monitored by subject at home; measured at least once between Visits 2, 3 and between Visits 8, 9 (8-point: fasting, pre-meal, post-meal, bedtime, 2:00 am); between each visit: Visit 3 to 8 (7-point: fasting, post-meal, pre-lunch, pre-dinner, bedtime). Post-meal: 2-hour period after breakfast, lunch, dinner. Change: average overall absolute, pre-meal, and post-meal blood glucose = HBGM at observation minus HBGM at baseline; pre-meal to post-meal blood glucose = HBGM at post-meal minus HBGM at pre-meal.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Hypoglycemic Events by Severity
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects with hypoglycemic events by severity. Severe hypoglycemia: subject unable to treat self; exhibits a neurological symptom; and blood glucose <=2.72 mmol/L or blood glucose not measured but symptoms reversed with food intake, SC glucagon, or intravenous glucose. If all 3 criteria not met, hypoglycemia defined as mild or moderate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Events of Nocturnal Hypoglycemia
secondary_outcome.description: Number of events of nocturnal hypoglycemia, incidence: midnight to 6:00 am. Hypoglycemia: characteristic symptoms of hypoglycemia with no blood glucose check; resolved with food intake, SC glucagon, or intravenous (IV) glucose; or symptoms with glucose <3.27 mmol/L (59 mg/dL); or any glucose measurement <=2.72 mmol/L (49 mg/dl). Severity of nocturnal glycemia not summarized.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Body Weight
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline calculated as body weight at observation minus body weight at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Body Mass Index (BMI)
secondary_outcome.description: BMI measured as kilograms per meter squared (kg/m2). Change calculated as BMI at observation minus BMI at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects Discontinued Due to Insufficient Clinical Response
secondary_outcome.description: Number of subjects discontinued due to signs and symptoms of persistent hyperglycemia or HbA1c > 12.0 % or frequent and unexplained severe hypoglycemic events (> 3 events per month for 2 or more months); subject's HbA1c not < = 7 % at Week 12.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Treatment Satisfaction, Quality of Life, and Mental Health
secondary_outcome.description: Subject reported outcomes for Diabetes Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire-Status (DTSQs), DTSQ-change, Patient Satisfaction with Insulin Therapy-16 item, Mental Health Inventory-17 item, and Euro Quality of life 5-Dimensions (EuroQol 5-D) Questionnaire not summarized due to cancellation of Exubera® program.

secondary_outcome.measure: Continuous Glucose Monitoring System (CGMS) 24-hour Glucose Profile in a Subset of Patients
secondary_outcome.description: The mean of the 24-hour mean and the mean of the 24-hour standard deviation (SD) (variability around the average glucose concentration) calculated on glucose values (mg/dl) collected during inpatient evaluation of glycemic stability. Interstitial glucose assessed at 5 minute intervals starting pre-supper on Day 1 of evaluation; ending on Day 3 pre-breakfast. Analysis is on data generated between 6:00 am on Day 2 and 6:00 am on Day 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Cardiovascular (CV) Biomarkers - High Sensitive C-reactive Protein (Hs-CRP)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in CV biomarker hs-CRP (milligrams per deciliter [mg/dl]) calculated as hs-CRP at observation minus hs-CRP at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in CV Biomarkers - Interleukin 6 (IL-6)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in IL-6 (picograms per milliliter [pg/ml]) calculated as IL-6 at observation minus IL-6 at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in CV Biomarkers - Thrombin-antithrombin Complexes (Tat-complexes)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in tat-complexes (nanograms per milliliter [ng/ml]) calculated as tat-complexes at observation minus tat-complexes at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in CV Biomarkers - Soluble Tissue Factor (STF)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in soluble tissue factor (pg/ml) calculated as STF at observation minus STF at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Urinary Free 8-iso Prostaglandin F2-alpha (α) in a Subset of Subjects
secondary_outcome.description: Urinary free 8-iso prostaglandin F2-alpha (α): compare glucose fluctuations and activation of oxidative stress as assessed by urinary isoprostanes in a subset of subjects randomized to either Exubera® or subcutaneous insulin glargine. The substudy was offered to all subjects. Data not summarized due to cancellation of Exubera® program.

intervention.description: Patient will be randomized to Lantus® while remaining on pre-study oral hypoglycemic agents.
Patient will be randomized inhaled insulin while remaining on pre-study oral hypoglycemic agents.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diabetes Mellitus, Type 2 on oral agents
- Age > 30 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Severe Asthma, severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
- Smoking

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Number of subjects randomized = 261; number of subjects treated (out of 261 randomized) = 257.

group.title: Inhaled Human Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhaled insulin regimen administered three times a day (TID) using Exubera® Inhaler device; insulin packaged as 1 or 3 milligram (mg) dry powder insulin. Initial daily dose determined based on subject's body weight and divided into 3 doses administered prior to major meals. Pre-meal doses modified based on meal size and pre-prandial blood glucose readings. Subjects combined 1 and 3 mg doses before each meal to control post-prandial glycemia in addition to continuing their usual oral (PO) drugs at the pre-study doses unless clinical need justified a dose modification.

group.title: Insulin Glargine (Lantus®)
group.description: Insulin glargine (Lantus®) 10 International Units (IU) injected subcutaneously (SC) once daily (QD) at the same time of day (morning dose recommended) for the duration of the study (26 Weeks) using a pen device where available. Daily dose of insulin glargine modified based on glucose measurements at the discretion of the treating physician. Insulin glargine added initially to subject's usual oral regimen and was to be continued at pre-study doses unless clinical need justified a dose modification.

participants_list.participants: Full Analysis Set = 134; 1 subject excluded; missing a baseline or postbaseline HbA1c measurement.
Full Analysis Set = 121; 1 subject excluded; missing a baseline or postbaseline HbA1c measurement.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin (HbA1c) at Week 26
outcome.description: Change (measured as percent): HbA1c at observation minus HbA1c at baseline. Primary objective to demonstrate non-inferiority of inhaled insulin compared to insulin glargine for glycemic control after 26 weeks of treatment not attainable due to early termination of study; analyses were descriptive and graphical.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) all randomized subjects with at least 1 dose of study medication, baseline and post-baseline HbA1c measurement. Last observation carried forward (LOCF).

outcome.population: FAS; LOCF; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and insulin glargine, respectively.

Insulin glargine added initially to subject's usual oral regimen and was to be continued at pre-study doses unless clinical need justified a dose modification.

measure.title: Number of Subjects Discontinued Due to Insufficient Clinical Response
measure.description: Number of subjects discontinued due to signs and symptoms of persistent hyperglycemia or HbA1c > 12.0 % or frequent and unexplained severe hypoglycemic events (> 3 events per month for 2 or more months); subject's HbA1c not < = 7 % at Week 12.
measure.population: Safety population: all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study medication.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Treatment Satisfaction, Quality of Life, and Mental Health
outcome.description: Subject reported outcomes for Diabetes Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire-Status (DTSQs), DTSQ-change, Patient Satisfaction with Insulin Therapy-16 item, Mental Health Inventory-17 item, and Euro Quality of life 5-Dimensions (EuroQol 5-D) Questionnaire not summarized due to cancellation of Exubera® program.

outcome.title: Continuous Glucose Monitoring System (CGMS) 24-hour Glucose Profile in a Subset of Patients
outcome.description: The mean of the 24-hour mean and the mean of the 24-hour standard deviation (SD) (variability around the average glucose concentration) calculated on glucose values (mg/dl) collected during inpatient evaluation of glycemic stability. Interstitial glucose assessed at 5 minute intervals starting pre-supper on Day 1 of evaluation; ending on Day 3 pre-breakfast. Analysis is on data generated between 6:00 am on Day 2 and 6:00 am on Day 3.
outcome.population: FAS; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and insulin glargine, respectively. Revised table rectifies a programming code error that was determined post-Clinical study report (CSR) approval.

group.title: Inhaled Human Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhaled insulin regimen administered three times a day (TID) using Exubera® Inhaler device; insulin packaged as 1 or 3 milligram (mg) dry powder insulin. Initial daily dose determined based on subject's body weight and divided into 3 doses administered prior to major meals. Pre-meal doses modified based on meal size and pre-prandial blood glucose readings. Subjects combined 1 and 3 mg doses before each meal to control post-prandial glycemia in addition to continuing their usual oral (PO) drugs at the pre-study doses unless clinical need justified a dose modification.

group.title: Insulin Glargine (Lantus®)
group.description: Insulin glargine (Lantus®) 10 International Units (IU) injected subcutaneously (SC) once daily (QD) at the same time of day (morning dose recommended) for the duration of the study (26 Weeks) using a pen device where available. Daily dose of insulin glargine modified based on glucose measurements at the discretion of the treating physician. Insulin glargine added initially to subject's usual oral regimen and was to be continued at pre-study doses unless clinical need justified a dose modification.

measure.title: Continuous Glucose Monitoring System (CGMS) 24-hour Glucose Profile in a Subset of Patients
measure.description: The mean of the 24-hour mean and the mean of the 24-hour standard deviation (SD) (variability around the average glucose concentration) calculated on glucose values (mg/dl) collected during inpatient evaluation of glycemic stability. Interstitial glucose assessed at 5 minute intervals starting pre-supper on Day 1 of evaluation; ending on Day 3 pre-breakfast. Analysis is on data generated between 6:00 am on Day 2 and 6:00 am on Day 3.
measure.population: FAS; (n) = number of subjects with analyzable data at observation for inhaled insulin and insulin glargine, respectively. Revised table rectifies a programming code error that was determined post-Clinical study report (CSR) approval.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Cardiovascular (CV) Biomarkers - High Sensitive C-reactive Protein (Hs-CRP)
outcome.description: Change from baseline in CV biomarker hs-CRP (milligrams per deciliter [mg/dl]) calculated as hs-CRP at observation minus hs-CRP at baseline.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Urinary Free 8-iso Prostaglandin F2-alpha (α) in a Subset of Subjects
outcome.description: Urinary free 8-iso prostaglandin F2-alpha (α): compare glucose fluctuations and activation of oxidative stress as assessed by urinary isoprostanes in a subset of subjects randomized to either Exubera® or subcutaneous insulin glargine. The substudy was offered to all subjects. Data not summarized due to cancellation of Exubera® program.

group.title: Inhaled Human Insulin (Exubera®)
group.description: Pre-prandial inhaled insulin regimen administered three times a day (TID) using Exubera® Inhaler device; insulin packaged as 1 or 3 milligram (mg) dry powder insulin. category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of < 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), < 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Enrollment period concluded earlier than planned due to cancellation of Exubera® program by sponsor; enrollment was undersized to meet requirements of its inferential objectives. Revised analysis approach was descriptive with no inferential analyses.
